aws::graph::propositions: # Meteorological Conditions and Weather Advisories for Flight Incident
Wind was from 360 degrees at 11 knots.
Visibility was 10 miles.
Overcast cloud ceiling was at 5,000 feet above ground level.
At Gunnison-Crested Butte Regional Airport (GUC), wind was variable from 200 to 260 degrees at 11 knots.
At Gunnison-Crested Butte Regional Airport (GUC), wind was gusting to 14 knots.
At Gunnison-Crested Butte Regional Airport (GUC), there was a broken cloud ceiling at 4,600 feet above ground level.
At Gunnison-Crested Butte Regional Airport (GUC), there was an overcast cloud layer at 5,000 feet above ground level.
Infrared satellite imagery depicted cloud temperatures of -16 degrees Celsius.
Cloud temperatures of -16 degrees Celsius corresponded to cloud tops at about 18,000 feet mean sea level.
Visible satellite imagery data depicted stratiform clouds obscuring the incident site.
There was little movement in the cloud cover over the region.
The cloud cover was consistent with altocumulus standing lenticular clouds.
Altocumulus standing lenticular clouds are associated with mountain wave activity.
The freezing level was at about 9,720 feet mean sea level.
A predominant mountain wave was identified at 14,480 feet mean sea level.
The mountain wave was consistent with enhanced icing potential.
Atmospheric modeling suggested freezing level at 10,900 feet mean sea level.
Atmospheric modeling suggested icing through 14,500 feet mean sea level.
Mountain wave conditions were expected.
The atmosphere was stable.
There was strong wind at the ridge level.
AIRMET advisories warning of Instrument Flight Rules conditions were issued by the National Weather Service at 1345.
AIRMET advisories warning of turbulence were issued by the National Weather Service at 1345.
AIRMET advisories warning of icing conditions were issued by the National Weather Service at 1345.
AIRMET Zulu, Update 7, warned of moderate icing conditions from the freezing level to 22,000 feet mean sea level.
Four pilot reports indicated light rime and mixed icing conditions in the vicinity of Aspen, Colorado.
The four pilot reports were made between 1330 and 1439.
The four pilot reports indicated icing at altitudes from 15,000 to 18,500 feet mean sea level.
One additional pilot report indicated moderate rime icing at 12,000 feet.
The additional pilot report was from about 15 miles west-southwest of ASE.
The additional pilot report was received at 1507.
The pilot received a preflight weather briefing at about 1251.
The pilot filed a flight plan using the ForeFlight application at about 1251.
The briefing included AIRMET Zulu, Update 6, issued at 1235.
AIRMET Zulu, Update 6 warned of moderate icing between the freezing level and 22,000 feet mean sea level.

text:
# Incident Report

## Meteorological Conditions

- Wind from 360 degrees at 11 knots, visibility 10 miles, and overcast cloud ceiling at 5,000 feet above ground level (agl)
- At Gunnison-Crested Butte Regional Airport (GUC):
    - Variable wind from 200 to 260 degrees at 11 knots, gusting to 14 knots
    - Broken cloud ceiling at 4,600 feet agl, with an overcast cloud layer at 5,000 feet agl

## Satellite Imagery

- Infrared satellite imagery depicted cloud temperatures of -16 degrees Celsius, corresponding to cloud tops at about 18,000 feet mean sea level (msl)
- Visible satellite imagery data depicted stratiform clouds obscuring the incident site
- Little movement in the cloud cover over the region, consistent with altocumulus standing lenticular clouds associated with mountain wave activity

## Upper Air Sounding

- Freezing level at about 9,720 feet msl
- Predominant mountain wave identified at 14,480 feet msl, consistent with enhanced icing potential
- Atmospheric modeling suggested freezing level at 10,900 feet msl, with icing through 14,500 feet msl
- Expected mountain wave conditions, with stable atmosphere and strong wind at the ridge level

## Advisories and Pilot Reports

- AIRMET advisories warning of IFR conditions, turbulence, and icing conditions issued by the NWS at 1345
- AIRMET Zulu, Update 7, warned of moderate icing conditions from the freezing level to 22,000 feet msl
- Four pilot reports of light rime and mixed icing conditions in the vicinity of Aspen, Colorado, between 1330 and 1439, at altitudes from 15,000 to 18,500 feet msl
- One additional pilot report of moderate rime icing at 12,000 feet about 15 miles west-southwest of ASE, received at 1507

## Preflight Weather Briefing

- The pilot received a preflight weather briefing and filed a flight plan using the ForeFlight application about 1251
- The briefing included AIRMET Zulu, Update 6, issued at 1235, warning of moderate icing between the freezing level and 22,
